reviews.review_msg:
Very kind professor, extremely supportive - the final essay requirement is 10 pages though so that's quite a tough ask for a 100 level course.

Kindhearted and positive person. :)
tough grader, with unclear grading scale.

Difficult to understand what he wants from assignments. Discussions based on Canada only, so if you're a foreigner, it'll be hard to engage. Canceled our class right before the term paper submission, so we could not ask questions. Takes ages to reply emails.
Criteria is actually all laid out in syllabus. Great lectures. Takes students seriously and tries to answer all questions. One of the best profs at SFU.
Doesn't have a clear grading criteria. He lectures in a confusing fashion. Takes 1 month to return the first assignment. Unable to know how you're doing until it's too late.

Nice guy, tries to keep the lecture interesting for some very dry material. Course is mostly centered around tutorial work (3 mini papers, participation, + 1 large paper) so communicate with TA. His exams are fair.

John-Henry is a caring prof that encourages questions in class and lays out a clear syllabus at the start of the semester. However, I found his lectures to be a little dry, he cancelled the morning of the lecture twice, and shows an obvious political bias when he's teaching. There's no final, so it's a good elective to balance your course load.

John Henry is a very good professor, he tries to really engage his students in discussion's and encourages questions. Marks decently hard, took participation marks so make sure to get involved in the discussions. He is very open and helpful with assignments if you need it. Defiantly the best professor i have had at SFU, and i would take again.

John-Henry is very enthusiastic about teaching labour studies. His assignments and mid-term are very straightforward, make sure you read the texts before class as he likes to engage in group discussions. He is very helpful and always available to discuss and questions you might have. I highly recommend taking any class taught by him!

Engaging and interesting personality, but extremely bias and narrow minded. Does not have clear expectations and marks labour studies exam as a history exam. Very specific and subjective expectations. Takes more than 3 days to respond to email.

Very good orator. Will intelligently debate any student's questions and ensure the entire class understands before moving on. Makes claims that will cause one to re-evaluate their faith in the capitalist marketplace, BUT ALWAYS backs up these claims with numerous arguments, causing dissenters to have to conjure up intelligent arguments of their own

I'm over halfway through the class, and I've had only two lectures. All the other classes have been movies, discussions, etc. I don't know about other classes, but for Labour Studies, he doesn't have a TA, he teaches the class himself. Really interesting class, and he's really good at answering questions and discussion.

Dale is an incredible lecturer and a caring soul. His passion for the labour studies subject matter is evident in lecture and tutorial. I learned a lot in his class. One can do well in his course by paying attention to his clear grading rubric and his instructions. I appreciated how he facilitated great discussions in class.

If you are not socialist do not take this class. The class is essentially left wing propaganda. If your not socialist and been working your whole life the discussions will drive you nuts.  A lot of improper statistics and devaluing of hard work.  Dale is a solid enough dude and teacher but the class is flawed on the whole.

Mark is the best prof ever! Anyone who has the opportunity should take a class with him. Will make you care about things in a way you never thought possible. While he may be a little disorganized at times, his passion for both history and his students more than make up for it.

Fun class, great lectures, but everything was really unclear. Never exactly sure what we were supposed to be getting out of lectures/readings, and nobody explained what our papers were being marked on until AFTER we had handed them in. Plus way too much of the mark (25%) came from participation, especially when the TA is so fond of talking herself.
Awesome prof, very nice + humourous, good marker
Awesome prof, great discussions in class
Progressive, clear, and VERY approachable. Highly recommend Labour Studies!
he's a good guy.
